review: Although it took little bit longer for the waiter to come to us to take the order, he took our order accurately and paid attention to our needs throughout our lunch. The place is clean and very friendly. Will visit again.

My little guy loves Red Robin because they have a mascot that looks like a big giant red bird. I apologize on his behalf. Their food used to be good. Now its "Acceptable". You can predict the future based on this trend. I walked in for a quick dinner with my 7 year old boy. This was on a Wednesday around 6 PM. The restaurant was slow. Empty tables everywhere. I noticed that most of the servers were not very much taller than my 7 year old boy. This place is filled with high school serving team (which in my opinion leads to the other problems).  Exhibit A: My server was a kid who was maybe 17/18. I have absolutely no issue with that. Damn, I have been working since I was 13. I am in favor of ethical child labor (parents know what I mean). However, here is my issue ---  the guy had 9 colors of rainbows in his hair (do not correct me here, I am giving him 2 extra colors for his creativity) his shirt unbuttoned, and his eye contact with the ceiling was phenomenal.  Where I come from there is a huge difference in freedom of expression and just being clean and tidy. And "unclean" and "slow" is not a good combination in any video game let alone in a restaurant.  Needless to say, the guy was slow in his response throughout the evening, chit chatting with other classmates of his height, refills took a while, etc. etc. You get the point. Other "kids" were also chit chatting and ignoring their tables. Someone needs to fix this.

Shroom and Swiss Veggie burger on a whole grain bun...with a side of sweet potato fries...heaven. Excellent service. I'll be back. TIP: American Express had a Four Square deal where if you check-in using Four Square and spend $30, you get $10 off.
Burgers were very well presented.  Overall a good meal.  Good wait service.

Great place to eat by yourself and/or with family and friends. The place is clean and the host and wait staff are always friendly, professional, and many are always willing to assist. My favorites are the Burning Love Burger, Banzai Burger, Whiskey River BBQ Burger, and you can never go wrong with the Royal Red Robin Burger (their signature burger). I just tried their new Prime Chophouse Burger and loved it. My kids love the Cod Basket (why at a burger place, who knows?) but I recommend if you are not feeling like burgers. The milkshakes are always great and there is so much they leave the Silver tin with the remainder of what the shake glass can't hold - that is if have room for ice cream after a big burger. This place rocks. I recommend if you are near the Dulles Greenway and/or in and about Ashburn.

The food served is typical American fare.  Most of us ordered hamburgers and the two little ones ordered kids meals.  We received excellent service from Sydney.  She was friendly and willing to accommodate all of our requests. Next time I go back, I'll be requesting to sit in her section.

Pretty decent burgers and fries.  Good, but nothing that would set the world on fire.  My biggest peeve with Red Robin is the bottomless basket of steak fries.  I love steak fries and usually the paltry portion that comes with the burger are not enough.  On each occasion, I have asked for more fries to eat with my burger and they usually show up late after I am done with the burger or not at all.  They are without limit but you'll have to pry them out of the kitchen and stay on the server.  So its a little misleading.  Still, I enjoy a Red Robin burger from time to time and this location fits the bill.

I love my Red Robin!!! Whisky river BBQ burger? Bonzie burger? So many outstanding burgers it's hard to try any new choices here! Yeah the atmosphere is geared towards kids but who care's! The food is great!  Go hungry, leave happy!

2 trips:   1.  Left my phone at work during lunch and look what I missed....a roach (lacocarocha, cockaroach, cockroach) crawled across our table.  AHHHHH!!!!  Might be great for kids, but not for me.   2.  Co-workers birthday:  service was soooo slow lunch took 2 (two!) hours.   Red Robin is a greasy, sloppy mess with bad service and obviously bad hygiene.  They give unlimited fries, but that isn't enough to go back.  Anyone who gives RR 5 stars and isn't under 5 years old, should have their yelp accounts reviews revoked!!

The service is pretty good and the restaurant is clean.  I'm just not a huge fan of the food here.  The burgers aren't very good, the fries are decent, and the desserts are just OK too. About the only thing I ever order here is the Red, White, and Blue Salad.  It's awesome!  The Maui Wings are really good for an appetizer, especially if you like sweet.  The cheese fries are absolutely nasty.  They put processed cheese under the real cheese and my boys wouldn't even touch it. I do like the renovations they made to this place.  It's still really noisy, but if you expect it, it's not a big deal.  We can still have a good conversation at the table. One thing that really annoys me and my oldest son is that they never ask how many kids menus we want.  They always just assume a 12 year old wants a kids menu.  Uh, not the way he eats.  The boy can pack away a Monster Burger, 2 servings of fries, and 2 Root Beer floats and still maintain a 6-pack.  Basically, hosts and servers a like need to stop assuming that kids want kid menus and sizes, they need to ask if every time if it wasn't made clear when being seated or when ordering.  We always try to clarify when ordering, but they still shouldn't assume.

Well I've read some of the reviews on Yelp about this particular Red Robin and I believe they have come a long way, since most of those reviews have been written. So as my wife and I are about to enter Red Robin we were immediately greeted by one of the hostess who also held the door open for us to enter. Next we proceeded into the store where we encountered another hostess waiting for seating requests. We told her how many were in our party and that we would prefer a booth. We were immediately seated (I think that was do to the fact that this place wasn't as packed as it normally is during the evening hours). Just a quick fyi, this place can be a bit noisy during the evening time. So if you want to have a more peaceful experience I would recommend coming during the earlier hours if possible. Ok our server (I think her name was Tazzania. I may have spelled that wrong) greeted us shortly after taking our seats. She quickly took our drink orders and gave us some time to decide what we would like to order. Finally when we were ready she took and placed our orders. She continuously checked on us to ensure we were okay while we waited (Which was good because I'm use to servers disappearing after taking my order). So after waiting for a while, but not to long she ended up bringing over a basket of their bottomless steak fries (Which I thought was pretty smart because customers don't like waiting long for their meal especially when they're hungry). After my wife and I completed the fries maybe about 8 to 10 minutes thereafter our food was served to us. I can't remember what my wife or myself ordered but it was quite tasty. I mean most of their menu items are pretty good. I haven't had everything on their so when in doubt just pick one of their burgers, I mean that's their specialty. I will say that their burgers (I'm just saying their burgers because this is their specialty, they do have other items on the menu other than burgers) aren't to die for, but I feel they are above average in taste, and fulfillment. All I'm saying is that most chain establishments are hit or miss but the key is how good are they at rebounding when issues are encountered and I know from first hand experience that if you are dissatisfied with your meal this Red Robin is quick to correct it and sometimes even comp your meal (I mean if a free meal for a honest mistake doesn't warrant them a 3 star rating then I think you may be, what people like to say where I'm from, "a certified hater"). But then again you could have actually run into a bad server and food so hopefully this isn't the case if you decide to come here. In the end I think this Red Robin is better than it was in the past and I can say that I do have more good experiences than bad experiences here at this Red Robin. Reeeeed Robin, Yuuuuuummmmm

Those who know me know I am not into fast food or chain restaurants, but I felt I had to write a review for this particular establishment in Ashburn.  My friends and I stopped in one night for a quick bite last Friday. As the place was fairly packed, we opted for a table in the bar. We were quickly greeted by our server, Ian. As I am gluten-free, I inquired about my old favorite (pre-diagnosed gluten allergy) Whiskey River BBQ Grilled Chicken Sandwich was GF. He had thought it was without the fried onion twists and recommended the gluten free bun or lettuce wrap for my sandwich. About two minutes after we ordered, he came back to say he had checked with his manager to ensure he was correct about the sandwich and found out that the sauce wasn't GF. He brought with him the GF recommendation list (there isn't a separate menu yet with RR) and I made a different choice.   I consider any server who takes the time to check ingredients for a customer without prompting is providing stellar service. I could have ended up back on steroids had I consumed gluten. I did go once previously in the last 6 months to this same establishment and the bartender then also helped me with the GF items by bringing me the list.  Based on service alone the restaurant merits a 5-star rating. I only give it a four because the food is typical American fast food-fairly tasty but not out of this world.

Oh man! This review is about a take out and from a person whose never been to a Red Robin.  So I pretty much wanted to have a burger yesterday since I'm a manly man and had to try something new. I've seen the catchy Red Robin commercials for years but never went... Now I live so close to one I had to try. Food was ready in about 15 minutes and once I got home I got down to work and man this burger was freaking amazing! I had the wolverine theme one and I couldn't even finish it.. So much for me being manly :(.  The fries are great, the burger was better than any other places I've been to such as Five Guys. I really recommend for burger fans to visit this place.
There burgers are awesome! Luv the fries too but, I usually keep seeing the same orders on the menu..

Come here with my boyfriend and best friend all the time for dinner. we normally always get great service. they always get the same thing unlimited root beer floats and burgers. i've only got a crapy waitress once. it didnt look like she was an employee either, he shirt didn't look like anyone elses and i had to ask like 5 times for that same thing, and was very slow. but other than the one waitress who could of been new it has always been a nice place but nothing of wow service.

Just because this is 4 stars does not mean it was not a 5 star experience. Getting that 5th star out of me I hard.  Tonight I went with my mother and my father.  We got immediately, server was at our table within minutes, an drinks were out right after that. I tried their new special Smoke & Pepper burger and man oh man was it delicious. The food did not taste crappy, but as if the chefs knew what they were doing. The waiter was really friendly and was constantly refilling our drinks.  Love Red Robin, will be back for sure.

My absolute favorite place. Food is fantastic. Wait staff is enthusiastic and attentive. My regular is the banzai burger. The onion rings are amazing and come in a larger tower or a smaller tower. Malts are good too!

10-year-old daughter review. I recently went to the Red Robin in Ashburn and was very satisfied. The service was quick, and very nice. Our zucchini sticks came out late because the waiter said it didn't look correct. I don't think any other restaurant would have the honesty.  The came out a couple minutes later and they tasted great. The hostess and the waiter were  welcoming. The kids meals have a good selection.  Our family will come back.

Oh my! One word- bland! I ordered the crispy arctic cod w/ mac n cheesy, hubby got the crispy chicken tender. Neither of us liked it. It had absolutely no flavor. The fish was so watery inside it totally soaked the bun underneath- nothing worse than a wet soggy bun ewww! Sandwich was humongous and was awkward eating it (not a first date sandwich)- felt like a pig eating it. Mac n cheese was tasteless. The eatery was nice n clean- no problems there, its just the food is yucky!...for lack of a better word :)

Yuck. Blech. Ugg. What a disappointing visit. The burger must have traversed the salt mines of Siberia making it almost in edible. The fish & chips must have been cooked in oil that is just shy of metamorphosing into low grade crude. The server (Davis) was attentive and quite good   There are plenty of places to get a decent burger in Ashburn, so you are better served Yelping something close by.

Usually I LOVE Red Robin but I was disappointed at this one. We felt pretty ignored by our server and had to wait until he ran the check to get refills. I was also disappointed in how I felt the burgers were cooked/put together and all around got the feeling that they didn't really care.  Super sad face am I, maybe if we go again things will be more upbeat.

Been here twice in 3 weeks and neither has gone smoothly. Both times our burgers took more than 45 minutes. Tonight the restaurant is not crowded and all tables are waiting for food. Our food did not come out hot after 45 min. Several in my party sent it back but I was too hungry to bother. The time I was here before the waitress dumped a drink on a couple near us. Bad luck - it happens but we are seeing a downhill trend here even though renovations to the facility have promise.  I will say the bar was friendly and it's good to find fat tire and ranger IPA on tap.

Very slow food service!  I don't know why I keep going back to this Red Robin!  The food quality is just okay at this location. This place just keeps getting worse the more I go, and I have been visiting since at least 2008. Somewhere along the way, this location stopped using fresh meat and chicken. The food tastes previously frozen and processed. Too bad because their burgers and chicken used to be amazing 10 years ago.  This evening 4 tables were all sticky in one area like the bus boy used the same rag all evening after cleaning up a soda spill.   The ladies restroom floor is filthy and could use deep cleaning.   My biggest complaint is that even though the restaurant was at half capacity and it was after dinner rush hour, the food took forever to come out. I think it took 40 minutes.  We ordered our food when we placed our drink orders and  we were there almost an hour and a half.  This is really unacceptable for a burger joint.  At a nice sit down restaurant I don't mind the wait, but when the food is burgers and fries, it should not take that long at all. It really was aggravating when the kids were hungry and the food took too long to come. This location will soon be remodeled...maybe they will also reorganize their kitchen to be more efficient as well!

What I thought would be a great place to take my son to celebrate his birthday turned out to be a total disappointment. I've gone to this place several times and celebrated my older son's birthday at Red Robin.. we left disappointed. The server was inattentive and forgot about the birthday even though I made a point about it. We never got refills on our drinks. I'm just happy we got to leave with balloons for the kids.
A really nice, friendly, and clean place to be! Dylan was our server, and he was extremely friendly and accomodating. I'd definitely go back!

Great food, great server, great atmosphere, everything you could ever want in a restaurant so I found no reason than to give this burger joint FIVE STARS!!  I ordered the Prime Chophouse burger (I've also had the Bacon Cheeseburger, and Crispy Arctic Cod) and the food never fails to impress. The bottomless fries and drinks are an added plus too. I totally reccommend the Freckled Lemonade, it is spectacular! Dave Lopez is the best server in the business! He is attentive, friendly, and quick! Try requesting to sit in his section for a great experience. The manager is great as well. If you are unsatisfied with your meal, he'll sincerely apologize and give you a free dessert, appetizer, etc. Truly fantastic! Five stars!
Love the shakes, drinks, and burgers! And you have to get ranch for the fries! The service can be a toss up, but I enjoy the food enough and prepare for it not to be perfect if I'm going to go.

As good as a Red Robin will get. Remember it's a chain restaurant people! You can't judge it too harshly. I have always had a good experience here and have never had an issue with order being wrong. Food always comes promptly and they give you free dessert if your waiter/waitress is in training. They also are always so accommodating to me- I always am switching up my order (no cheese, onion bun please, and can I have extra pickles, etc).

Don't know what happen but received the worse service today? I waited for 10 minutes for someone to take my order then another 30 minutes for my food to come burger wasn't cooked well not sure if I will ever come here again absolutely horrible

Last few times I went here (including the last time I reviewed the place), the food screamed "meh".  Well, apparently that's more than enough for the management, because they now act as if they have a captive audience. Our waiter was inattentive - so much so that he screwed up four different orders from four different in a row during a period where the restaurant was nigh empty - as well as slow (seriously, does it take fifteen minutes to get refills for drinks that aren't alcoholic and in a nearly-empty restaurant?) Furthermore, and I don't know if this was the waiter's or the cooks' fault, but the burgers tasted exceptionally blase and they forgot the avocado on both my wife's (avocado-Cobb) and my mother-in-law's (BLTA, last for avocado) salads.  My wife's clam chowder tasted as though it was drowned in anything but clam. It took talking to the manager to straighten things out...and we weren't the only one.  In my opinion, she was the only one who earned her pay that night. Wish I could say we won't be going back, but my in-laws - and others, hence the captive audience - love the place.  Maybe that's the problem.
Nice friendly place with good service and good food.  Burgers are tasty and the Onion Rings amazing!

Unfortunately, my kids clamor for this place. So we're sorta captive audience here, and I think the management must know it.  I won't comment on the food (it's decent enough) but the service here at this location is often subpar. There's been at least one occasion where we had to wait so long for our food (1 hr+ after ordering) that we took it to go. Tonight I took my three kids and only ordered kids meals (didnt order my meal, because I thought it would be quicker. Took 15 minutes to get our order, and then another 30 minutes to get a grilled cheese, a mac and cheese and a spaghetti. This has been our typical experience.  When you have hungry kids, this is NOT the place to take them. Our waitress took our orders and then disappeared except to tell us once that our food was coming (never checked on our drinks or anything) until after our food came.

We came on a Friday night and there was no wait. Shortly after we realized there is no wait and no AC. The temperature today was in the upper 90's. What restaurant doesn't have a back up plan such as a generator? I will go ahead and answer that- this one. When we inquired about the air conditioning or lack of we were asked " didn't the hostess tell you it wasn't working"? Well would we have inquired and still choose to eat here? Probably not.  For appetizers we chose mozzarella sticks and their buzzard wings. Wings were average and sticks were well frozen then fried  battered cheese. Not much to rave about. The wait seemed long based on how full or actually how empty the place was. Waitress was very polite and checked on us often. We ordered the grilled southwest chicken salad. The portion was good size. Another member of our group of 5 ordered the Crab cake sandwich. It was good but had a bitter after taste. I had the chicken sandwich which was special ordered. It came exactly as requested. Unfortunately it too had a very strong after taste of old oil. The waitress had it quickly replaced. The after taste was still their but not to the extent it previously was. The other 2 meals were kids meals. The chicken on a stick is too small a portion for anyone over the age of 4. Mac and cheese comes unlimited but since it's all carbs the kids get full and do not request additional portions. Overall the restaurant tried to make sure we left satisfied. We would visit again but would prefer they have air conditioning.
This Red Robin has been pretty good. They are consistent with the food quality (even though the portions have been cut down).  The service is always good, no doubt about that. Bar area is mostly

Slowwwwww.  6 pm on friday.  Every table had 2 or more kids under about the age of 6.  Clearly the place to go if you have youngsters.  Was loud and a bit raucous which was fine but waitress (or kitchen) was incredibly slow.  Food took more than 30 minutes to arrive and when it did it was cold.  Waitress offered to bring hot fries and she did about 10 minutes later.  And then as we were getting ready to leave she brought two more baskets of fries.  Burgers were tasty but buns were cold and burgers were lukewarm.  Not a place to go if you are in a hurry or dont like kids scrwaming but their specialty burgers are as good as any other burger in Ashburn.  Did i say it was slowwwwww?

We are regulars here! Food portion and variety is awesome. Pricing is great too! We prefer to sit in the bar when we go. The only opportunity they have is their hot sauces are SO GREASY....always gives me acid reflux!

Red Robin is a nice quick go to place, especially for a good burger and fries, when you are looking for greater quality than fast food. Casual dining experience with a full bar, the service is pretty quick and take out/pick up orders are an option. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Prices are reasonable as well.
i used to like this place until the waiter spilled soda on me. She said she was sorry. But then she walked away and started Laughing! not nice

My wife, daughter and I arrived at the restaurant at approximatley 6:30 pm Saturday night.  The restaurant looked about 75% full.  Danny, our server, was prompt to greet us and take our drink order. About 5-minutes later Danny took our dinner order.  One hour later we had yet to receive our dinner. I sought out the restaurant manager to see if he could expedite the order. No apology, he just said he would see what was holding it up.  Meanwhile, Danny made repeated visits to our table to apologize for our order being late.  Our food finally arrived at 7:50 p.m., one hour and twenty minutes from ordering. The food was cold and my daughter's first round of 'bottomless fries" included six, yes six, french fries.  The manager returned and apologized profusely and said "an order that is 40-minutes late is unacceptable." 40? He comped the entire meal, which we felt was the right thing to do. Poor Danny returned to our table for one last apology. He did his job, kitchen management let him down.  We will not be returning here.

Parents Beware, Red Robin now charges $2 for your kids to play games at the table, and the fee is not disclosed in advance by the servers.   Given that this is a franchise that caters primarily to kids, I can't believed that they have stooped to such low levels with these ridiculous fees.    Shame on you Red Robin.

We eat here almost every month. Depend on the server, sometimes food is served very fast. We ate there around 2:00 pm today, services were very slow. We waited around 20 mins for our food. The place is more dirty than before. The self check out and self services thing on the table are full of dirty oily finger print. Very disappointed.

After a mishap with another reservation elsewhere, we decided to go with Red Robin. We called the night before our event to see if they could accommodate a group of 20 on a Friday night. They said they could do so without a problem! Friday came around and our table was ready and waiting for us. It was a little tight in between our two tables but we all were able to fit! The food/pricing was great. I had the DGB which was delicious and flavorful. It was drizzled in olive oil but was a little too much for my liking. Nothing a quick dab with a napkin couldn't fix though!  Our server was David and he was awesome! He was extremely helpful. Other employees came by and helped with our party and they were great as well. We had two children with us and they were awesome about having their food out first. Also the employees offered to sing a jingle for our birthday celebrant! Overall: It was a great experience for a last minute party for a large group.
Service was good.  But this machine at the table....don't touch it.  It charged me $$$ to play a trivia game I didn't even attempt to play.   Not happy

Great tasting food.  Prompt, attentive, and friendly service.  Reasonable prices.  They've added some healthy options, too, like salads and broccoli as a side instead of fries, but I couldn't resist the gravitational pull of the milk shakes.

Great Burgers great shakes awesome mixed drinks. People are always friendly and smiling. Good place to watch football also. Our regular place was over crowded so we ended up at Red Robin. They even turned the game up for us. Always a pleasure and we will definitely return.

Something was off today with service... alot of wait/dead time.  Not busy.  I had to get up and ask Bartender for silverware.  Repeat requests from several staff.... forgotten items.  A first with this location.  But, overall... always great quality food!
Food is ok but the service is way below standard.. What's the point of having a greeter at the front door if they don't greet you or take your name down?.

Took the family yesterday early evening right before dinner rush (weekday). Typical happy hour options (limited). Waiter mistakenly gave me the wrong size but didn't charge the difference.  Food: as most have said, it's a chain restaurant. Better off keeping things simple. "Less is more" when it comes to their toppings ... Relish is standard?? When ordering, speak clearly and make sure they understand you. Not the first time at this location they forget something or forget to take out an ingredient. The small amount of fries is likely because they are more filling, they try to keep them fresh/hot for you, but it does mean more trips for the waiters if you eat "bottomless." Kids meals are not very tasty.  Prices seem a bit high even for a sit down. Hard to compete with so many other (better) burger places in LoCo. Will say service wasn't bad. They did offer a drink mistakenly made complimentary to us. Trying to be like Chili's with the screens at each table. Quite frankly think it's a distraction.  Does mean you can pay immediately when you want to leave, just means less work for the waiters...which means they should be more efficient, right?

Unfortunately some exec decided to try to be "creative" and put these stupid tablets on the table. It was fine when it's me sitting at a bar. I can pay my bill with it, it's novel, whatever.  When I bring in my kids and they are tapping on it and I end up with a $2 "entertainment fee" then someone is trying to run a scam. Thousands of people that never notice, no explicit authorization, huge hassle to get it removed. I would have paid $2 not to spend another 10 minutes waiting for someone to walk past...and we get to the crux of the issue. These things have turned the servers into robots. They show up, get a drink order, bring you the drinks and then the next time you see them, literally see them, is when they bring you food 15-20 later. The drinks are empty, except for the top shelf margarita that was actually just sour mix but no one was around to fix it so you eventually carried it to the bar to a confused bartender and worked it out yourself. This is a superficial description of a much larger issue but I don't care enough to take my time to explain it.  It's a cultural change, the affect is obvious and it's a losing business proposition. Case in point, after years of patronage, I'm done with this place.

Yes yes yes....I know their jingle....RED ROBIN....Yuuuuummmmm..... so been here several times without writing a review cause nothing has really overwhelmed me to write. Usually get water/iced tea, bottomless fries, and whiskey river bbq burger which is good but really messy. The service has been fair to good but not super consistently good. Some training would help. But last night pretty much took the cake. We were a party of ten. It wasnt too crowded on a Monday night so there were plenty of servers. I knew I was screwed when I asked for two...TWO waters and I only got one. WHY TWO? Cause I know that it takes forever to get refill. And yes I was right, having only one glass of water, refills took forever! I wanted try something new (big mistake). The new menu insert showed a new crab cake sammich with ciabatta bread, panko fried lump crab cake, lettuce, sun dried tomatoes, and some kind of sauce. I asked our server if the crab cake itself was thick. She replied with an astounding yes. Okay, it doesnt look super thick or jumbo lumpy, I'll take her word for it. When I got the sandwich, surprise surprise. Granted the crab cake was fried to a golden brown color, the patty was not thick, hence no JUMBO LUMP crab meat. It's more backfin meat. It was well seasoned. The bread was dried (should have been toasted with butter), more tarter sauce was needed, and the tomatoes should have been fresh instead of sundried. Instead of making it fancy, make it good. For almost 15.00, I felt like I was robbed. It should have been a 10.00 sammich. And the fries, cmon man, crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside. ITS NOT ROCKET SCIENCE PEOPLE!!!!! Service and food failed last night. (JINGLE) RED ROBIN......MEEEEEEEEEHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!

Red Robin isn't one of those go-all-the time restaurants, at least for me, but when I do, I love it! GET THE ONION RINGS!! it is probably the best appetizer on the menu. When I was finished, I was so stuffed I wanted to run home! I LOVE RR

Sooooo, after several months of being disappointed with this place, we stopped by tonight and both the food and service were top-notch.  Based on how awful this place has been in the past, I don't think they could've pulled off such an excellent night by coincidence.  They've had to make some fairly solid changes in both the kitchen and the service areas for the vast improvement to be this noticeable.  I just hope it sticks.

Yum, this is my 3.5 yo's fav place to go! We enjoy ourselves and our food here. She loves grabbing a ballon & a scribble on the chalk board on the way out. :) be careful of the video games on the table. They automatically charge a fee to your bill. Paying at the table is nice so you don't have to wait for the server. Good stuff. :)

Red Robin is good for their burgers I feel like, but when I have a hankering for a burger, Red Robin is not the first place I think of. No doubt they do have some good dishes, but it's not something like "Oh man! I am craving some Red Robin!!" I did recently try their ramen burger and let me just say, let me save you the trouble. The outside is of course crispy, but when you bite into it, it's all soft. The burger itself is just super messy and nothing stays together. I thought the sauce for the burger was weird. It didn't pair well with the burger at all. I could barely finish half and took the other half home to finish later, but I ended up just throwing it away. It's not a bad place here, but I think depending on what you want to eat you have other options. Oh, they have a new on table ordering... tablet thing. You can browse the menu and order from there, but if I'm not mistaken the full menu is not available. Appetizers, desserts, drinks, and some specials were though. You also have the option to pay straight from there without calling the waiter and there are options to do split check as well. Thought that was cool.

We had just gotten off the plane after several months overseas. We all wanted a legit american burger and red robin was the place to go. We were not disappointed. The food was top notch, as was the freckled lemonade. Service was friendly and attentive-- everything was clean and bright. And I loved their new comfy chairs.

Good burgers; many customization options to chose from especially if you like your burger spicy. The ghost pepper sauce is excellent and I enjoy having fresh jalapeños as an option. The fries are okay; endless supply here and they also offer garlic Parmesan. Nice atmosphere and the staff is courteous and responsive. The sesame seed bun was a little dry but ok; I like how they offer iceberg lettuce as a bun alternative. I like Red Robin; it's a safe choice.

Awesome turkey burgers and bottomless fries. Love them. My kid ate all of her fries and Mac and cheese  Great draft beer selection too. Dogfish head on tap amazing.  What's not to like.  Since my office Mountcastle Plastic surgery & Vein Institute is a couple blocks away I will definitely bring my staff here for lunch now that I have found this hidden gem.

I ordered the sombrero southwest salad. it looked and smelled excellent on first inspection. The toasted tortilla was a tasty touch. The greens were adequate / satisfactory but they included unripe avocado in the salad which was unpleasant.  I know this place is known for their burgers but exercise caution before ordering anything with avocado from here.

As if the lack of parking was not bad enough, to sit in a lobby full of 0 people for 10 minutes without acknowledgment from the staff was absolutely ridiculous. My only assumption was that the original host/hostess silently quit while no one was looking. Using a more proactive approach to resolving the issue,  I approached the closest team member out of about 7 who observed me during this period to see if she could alert someone. She sneered and all but rolled her eyes as if I were disturbing her. As the lobby gained 2 new parties, finally a non-smiling staff member arrived and rushed the party after us to their seat while we continued to wait for service. We were quickly corralled to our booth while we requested management assistance. The manager was nice & did offer a free appetizer. The server was also nice,  but it was a bit disturbing that we had to wait an ungodly amount of time for a simple apple juice. We'd finished our other drinks & received our appetizer by the time it arrived. Of course, I am learning that the norm these days is to order medium-well and get well. There was no pink & the burger was suspiciously extra salty. I was able to only eat half. The bottomless fries were good. The kid's meatballs were deplorable. That entire plate looked as if it had been mercilessly microwaved. The broccoli was tough and the meatballs were hard. Only the cracker sticks were edible. As for me,  lesson learned: I've got to stop eating at these chain restaurants. The only reason I ended up there in the first place is because I didn't realize Foster's Grille had closed.

This location is fairly new and so far they are holding up to standards at the other locations. We have had a few issues with ordering so far but they have been quick to fix these problems. Staff has been friendly and we are quick to be seated. Will be going back for sure to this location.
Been coming here for a while with friends and family over the years. Pleasant experience

This is the worst Red Robin I have ever been to! They kept apologizing for the wait, but the restaurant was half empty! Once we got our food it was cold. The manager comped our meal but she also had to comp the group next to us for the same reasons. The restroom was utterly disgusting! Horrible food and service! Don't go unless you want a stomach ache and be up all night in the restroom. And that is just from the salad!

Always happy with my experiences here! Sometimes the wait to be seated can take a while, but once were seated, its great. The servers are good- very efficient, friendly, quick, and there before you know you need them. Food is delicious and easy pay (at the table) makes it that much more convenient. Overall, a great restaurant for good burgers and fun!

Last week my kids and I went here and it was such a meh experience. We went around 4:30 and it was pretty slow. We were seated by a very polite hostess and greeted by our server. She looked less than excited to see us at her table; I don't even think she gave us her name. She took our drink orders. She came back delivered the drinks and took our orders. We had two kids meals and two adult meals. For it not being busy I was shocked that it took the kids' meals to come out in 20 minutes. As we sat and watched the kids eat, becoming parched bc we had gone through our water and there was no sign of our server, she finally returned 15 minutes after the kids' meals had come out. She said is there anything I can get you? We said "umm yeah our food." She made up some excuse, like its probably coming to the window now and ran to the kitchen, where we could clearly see our food sitting on the window. She brought it over, not even an apology. We ate the burgers which were fine and never saw her again until we were getting up to leave. I get that food can take time to cook, but 45 minutes for two burgers? and to not refill our drinks or ask? and on top of it all not even apologize for the wait, so disappointing. Needless to say we won't be headed back to this location.  FYI I am giving them two stars based on the food and the hostess encounter.

Stopped in for a quick bite. Jacob waited on us and gave us the BEST service I've ever experienced at this location. He was so sweet and attentive. Also, he was very knowledgeable about the menu. When I told him I was in the mood for a salad, he suggested I try the Avo Cobb salad. It was so tasty and exactly what I was wanting. I've been trying to watch my calories but he made the shakes sound so good that I couldn't refuse. We had a raspberry chocolate shake and the mint brownie. The mint one was better than a Shamrock shake from McDonalds, and even came with real brownie bites on top of the whipped cream. Jacob has a great smile, personality, wonderful with children and made us laugh. Thanks for the great experience and keep up the good work!

The best place to get burgers in the Ashburn area! They have a huge selection and they also have amazing salads. The price is great and the service always rocks. They have outstanding milkshakes and desserts. Always fresh new apps and drinks. Freckled lemonade is always a great option for a drink! Good place to bring the whole family for any kind of dinner party!
Not that great. Soup was cold. Server was slow and never came back to check on us. Had to flag him down to get hot soup. Never came over to finish out the bill. The sad part is it wasn't crowded.

This Red Robin has really gone downhill since the last time I ate there a couple of months ago!!!  My daughter and I had dinner last night and the restaurant wasn't even half full.  The waiter wasn't attentive and I had to call for him whenever I wanted something.  I ordered a half stack of onion rings with two small cups of ranch dressing.  I got the onion rings with one side of ranch and one side of BBQ ranch.  I ordered the jumbo shrimp with "burnt" fries as I like the fries extra crispy.  The fries were not crispy and I had to reorder them.  The shrimp didn't taste very good.  I ordered a pineapple coconut smoothie to go.  After waiting for 10 minutes I asked the waiter if I could have my smoothie.  He said he would get it.  When the waiter brought the smoothie to the table the plastic cup that it was in was covered with smoothie it was oozing out of the top and dripping down the sides of the cup. I tried to wipe it off but there was just too much and so I ended up leaving it because I couldn't take that in my car.  I won't be going back to this Red Robin Restaurant!

This restaurant is close to home and great when I have a craving for a burger. The staff is always so friendly (even when they are slamming busy with big groups following local high school games). In the 5 years I've lived nearby I've been many times for a quick bite at the bar or for carry out and while the food is spot on 95% of the time (nobody is perfect), I have to say when it's been wrong they have gone way above in fixing my problem.  The smoke & pepper burger is my fav, with the guacamole burger a close second. Great food, great atmosphere and great staff.
The food and service were fine.  It was so hot in the dining room that we ended our meal early. We asked the server about it and the reply was "yes..it's Been that way for quite a while ."

The burgers are decent enough. The service here has been consistently unreliable on the three or four visits we've had here. The Fair Lakes location has much better service. We've experienced in Ashburn hosts and hostesses not particularly friendly, waiters and waitresses that are slow and don't come by all that often, and unusually long waits for food after ordering even when visiting during off-peak times with light traffic in the dining room.

My Double Tavern Burger had tiny pieces of bone in it!  When we spoke to the manager about it and gave her the biggest sharpest piece - she said thank you for letting me know - no sign of concern and no apology. Maybe she is used to getting this complaint. We will not be going back here.

Update #2 (10/27/2017): We just returned from what was supposed to be a happy birthday dinner for our son. The bacon cheeseburgers were very greasy and very messy. The fries were limp and room temperature.  But the worst part of the meal wasn't the food, it was the service. Aisha is one of the most indifferent and unpleasant waitresses I've ever encountered. She had zero personality and lacked a sense of urgency.  We told her it was our son's birthday and she completely disregarded that since the only singing we heard was for the table next to ours  =(  We waited for her to bring our bill but she was nowhere to be found. So we paid using the very impersonal table device. When she saw me using it, she finally showed up to the table, saw that I paid, and said something like, "thanks" or "goodbye" (I couldn't understand her because she was walking away as she was talking so her back was turned away from us.)

Review update:  Been going back once or twice a month and sitting in the bar. Chris the bartender/waiter in the bar area is fantastic and he has an awesome beard.  It has been more enjoyable to sit in that area (though there is sports on tv).  Many props to him for being awesome! If you like touching a screen that everyone else has touched to call a waiter, or pay your bill then this place is for you!  I would hate to see what germs are growing on that thing. So gross.   But wait there is more! A rush of hot air from the overworking heaters smashes into you while walking in. Greeting from the hostess was friendly, but immediately I was sweating.  I get that it is 9 degrees or something outside, but does it really have to be 80 inside when everyone has jackets/boots on? One of the wait staff noted that they have no control over the temperature. Surely someone has to have control because I can't imagine cooking like that in an open kitchen. The staff must have been seriously dying in that heat, because I was dying.  Tables were closely pushed together and as someone gets up from an opposing table or booth, you are bumped or your purse is bumped if it is on the back of the chair.  The restaurant was loud with children screaming and on top of it being hot, It out me in a bad mood. Now I know I don't come to Red Robin for a fine dining experience, but I will never come back to this location.  A few months ago we were here and it was not like this at all. In fact, it was a pleasant experience with unlimited sweet potato fries. Can't beat that! I wish this time it was better.  What's the point of having wait staff and adding an appropriate tip when all the staff is doing is taking drink orders/maybe food orders and bringing food. Makes it easier for machines to do jobs.

I come here occasionally when craving a good burger. I tried the curbside pickup fir the first time. I selected 5pm as my pickup time. I arrived around 4:50pm and they brought my food at 5pm, so they were very punctual.  Normally I don't have an issue with my order, but this time I ordered sweet potato fries,  no salt. There was some salt on there...it wasn't a lot, but I don't like salt on my sweet potato fries. The burger was delicious as usual.   I'm looking forward to returning to this location.
